glsa.title: Openswan: Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: A NULL pointer dereference in Openswan may allow remote attackers to cause Denial of Service.

background.p: Openswan is an implementation of IPsec for Linux.

description.p: A NULL pointer dereference has been found in Openswan.

impact.p: A remote attacker could create a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: Gentoo has discontinued support for Openswan. We recommend that users unmerge Openswan:

NOTE: The Gentoo developer(s) maintaining Openswan have discontinued support at this time. It may be possible that a new Gentoo developer will update Openswan at a later date. Alternatives packages such as Libreswan and strongSwan are currently available in Gentoo Portage.
